• camel donkey or elephant riding ( under appropriate supervision ) ; • dancing ; • dog sledding ; • diving underwater at a depth no great than 10 metre ; • diving underwater use an artificial breathing apparatus at a depth no great than 10 metre ( in order to be cover for this activity you must hold an open water diving licence recognise in australia or dive with an instructor license for these activity and note that restriction apply - refer to general exclusion ' diving alone ' ) ; • fishing ( on land or within 2 nautical mile of land ) ; • fruit picking that do not involve the use of machinery ; • go - karting ; • golf ; • gym activity ( exclude powerlifting ) ; • gymnastic ( exclude competition ) ; • horse riding ( exclude competition equestrian event steeple chasing jumping or polo ) ; • ice skating on a rink ( exclude competitive skating racing speed skating and tour skating ) ; • leisure activity ( mean any activity involve minimal physical exertion that be undertake for relaxation or pleasure for example sight - see picnic photography and museum or art gallery visit ) ; • music and singing ; • orienteere ; • paintball ( with eye protection ) ; • race on foot as an amateur for distance up to and include full marathon ( 42.2 kilometre or 26.2 mile ) and note that restriction apply - refer to general exclusions ' activity ' and ' professional sport ; • racquet and ball sport not involve physical contact ; • regulate or license ballooning ; • river cruise ; • rockwall climb ( under appropriate supervision ) ; • safari ( under appropriate supervision but not hunt ) ; • sail up to 10 nautical mile from land ; • shark cage diving ( subject to diving restriction list above ) ; • shooting ( fix target only ) ; • skateboard roller skating inline skating ( exclude vert skating or acrobatic ) ; • snorkelling at a depth no great than 10 metre ; • soccer ; • surface water activity in river or rapid grade i ii or iii under the international scale of river difficulty or lake or canal ( see www.waterwaysguide.org.au/ gradingsystem ) ; • surface water activity ( other than sailing ) up to 2 nautical mile off any land mass ; • track and field athletic ; and • walking hiking trek or tramping peak at altitude up to 3,000 metre where specialist climbing equipment be not require ( exclude expedition to or on the kokoda track / trail )

Text: an aml / ctf program must include appropriate risk‑base system and control for the reporting entity to determine : ( 1 ) whether the electronic datum be reliable and independent take into account the follow factor : ( a ) the accuracy of the datum ; ( b ) how secure the datum be ; ( c ) how the datum be keep up‑to‑date ; ( d ) how comprehensive the datum be ( for example by reference to the range of person include in the datum and the period over which the datum have be collect ) ; ( e ) whether the datum have be verify from a reliable and independent source ; ( f ) whether the datum be maintain by a government body or pursuant to legislation ; and ( g ) whether the electronic datum can be additionally authenticate ; and ( 2 ) what reliable and independent electronic datum the reporting entity will use for the purpose of verification ; ( 3 ) the reporting entity ’ s pre‑defined tolerance level for match and error ; and ( 4 ) whether and how to confirm kyc information collect about a customer by independently initiate contact with the person that the customer claim to be

Text: for the purpose of this act a person ( the discriminator ) discriminate against another person ( the aggrieved person ) on the ground of a disability of the aggrieved person if because of the disability the discriminator treat or propose to treat the aggrieved person less favourably than the discriminator would treat a person without the disability in circumstance that be not materially different
Process_description: a candidate 's application be evaluate by review their work history for relevant experience check their education and certification assess their skill and qualification and verify their reference the applicant 's availability and personal situation be also evaluate additional information include personal information and employment history may be collect and the candidate 's consent be obtain for their information to be use for the hiring process while ensure that their information be securely store in compliance with datum privacy regulation if the candidate seem like a good fit for the position an interview be schedule with the candidate and stakeholder and the interview be prepared and conduct finally either a professional rejection letter be send or a clear and concise contract offer be prepare and send together with further document to the candidate to inform they of their positive application outcome and the next step to ensure employment

Text: when assess the adequacy of the level of protection the commission shall in particular take account of the follow element : ( a ) the rule of law respect for human right and fundamental freedom relevant legislation both general and sectoral include concern public security defence national security and criminal law and the access of public authority to personal datum as well as the implementation of such legislation datum protection rule professional rule and security measure include rule for the onward transfer of personal datum to another third country or international organisation which be comply with in that country or international organisation case - law as well as effective and enforceable datum subject right and effective administrative and judicial redress for the data subject whose personal datum be be transfer ; ( b ) the existence and effective functioning of one or more independent supervisory authority in the third country or to which an international organisation be subject with responsibility for ensure and enforce compliance with the datum protection rule include adequate enforcement power for assist and advise the datum subject in exercise their right and for cooperation with the supervisory authority of the member states ; and ( c ) the international commitment the third country or international organisation concern have enter into or other obligation arise from legally bind convention or instrument as well as from its participation in multilateral or regional system in particular in relation to the protection of personal datum

Text: in the case of a personal data breach the controller shall without undue delay and where feasible not later than 72 hour after having become aware of it notify the personal datum breach to the supervisory authority competent in accordance with article 55 unless the personal datum breach be unlikely to result in a risk to the right and freedom of natural person where the notification to the supervisory authority be not make within 72 hour it shall be accompany by reason for the delay
Process_description: the process be from the general data protection regulation and involve several step whenever a data breach occur regard an individual 's datum the process commence with a notification of a data breach to the data controller trigger a series of critical action to manage the incident the datum controller upon receive the notification evaluate the breach 's severity if the breach be deem notifiable the national authority be promptly inform and a detailed breach record be create this record include all relevant detail necessary for thorough documentation and future reference concurrently the datum subject be also notify of the breach this ensure transparency and allow the datum subject to take any immediate personal measure to mitigate the impact communication with the datum subject continue as the process unfold keep they inform of the evolve situation the breach evaluation then proceed to a decision point where it be determined if the breach be cause by high - risk factor if the evaluation conclude that high - risk element be present the process move towards a more rigorous evaluation encompass an in - depth security analysis should the further evaluation confirm the high - risk nature of the breach the datum be then delete or alter to mitigate the breach 's impact strictly adhere to the high security standard require in such scenario this decisive action be critical to prevent further unauthorized access or damage if the breach be not high - risk or after the high - risk datum have be deal with the national authority assess whether to issue a public notification if a public notification be necessary the information be disseminate accordingly ensure that all potential impact party be aware of the breach follow the potential public notification the process conclude with a final review to ensure all step have be appropriately execute and document the end event signify the closure of the incident response with all action complete and the breach contain and manage accord to protocol throughout the process datum integrity and security as well as compliance with regulatory standard be maintain demonstrate the organization 's commitment to responsible datum management and protection

risk factor if the evaluation conclude that high - risk element be present the process move towards a more rigorous evaluation encompass an in - depth security analysis should the further evaluation confirm the high - risk nature of the breach the datum be then delete or alter to mitigate the breach 's impact strictly adhere to the high security standard require in such scenario this decisive action be critical to prevent further unauthorized access or damage if the breach be not high - risk or after the high - risk datum have be deal with the national authority assess whether to issue a public notification if a public notification be necessary the information be disseminate accordingly ensure that all potential impact party be aware of the breach follow the potential public notification the process conclude with a final review to ensure all step have be appropriately execute and document the end event signify the closure of the incident response with all action complete and the breach contain and manage accord to protocol throughout the process datum integrity and security as well as compliance with regulatory standard be maintain demonstrate the organization 's commitment to responsible datum management and protection

Text: drum : the original quest m3 roaster ( up to may 2013 production ) have a clockwise - turn drum thick than that of the m6 mk-2 and m3s version which turn anticlockwise note that the drum be not interchangeable as the vane must be orient to move the bean toward the front of the roaster some poster on coffee blog have opine that some quest model route the bean to the back ; this be incorrect all the drum be open at both end except the m3s and the m6 drum which have perforate backplate the m6 drum be the same as the m3s drum but ~7 cm long the drum in all quest roaster turn at a constant rate use a 30 - watt motor attach to a speed - reduce gearbox the shape number and size of the drum ’ s vane have change over the year and model
